channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Resistance Money: A Philosophical Case for Bitcoin
item.description: Should I add bitcoin to my portfolio? If not, why not? This book will help advisors field these tough client questions.

item.title: Happy 60th Anniversary CAPM! Why the Capital Asset Pricing Model Still Matters
item.description: The CAPM has its critics. Yet, the model, introduced by Bill Sharpe in 1964, remains front and center in academia and in practice.

item.title: Georgia Supreme Court to consider new GOP-backed ballot rules after judge strikes down
item.description: The Georgia Supreme Court will hear the RNC's appeal of a judge's decision to block several new election rules from taking effect.

item.title: Tourism revenue drops in Greece despite sharp summer tourism crunch
item.description: Industry revenue fell by 1.8 percent compared to last year even as the number of tourists grew by 6.6 percent.

item.title: Can The 25th Amendment Withstand A Weaponized Justice System?
item.description: A new documentary on the vice presidency gives a fresh perspective on the complications of American governance.

item.title: The School Choice Programs Democrats Hate Have Saved Taxpayers Up To $45 Billion
item.description: When families receive an ESA, which is typically around half of what the state spends per public education student, the state saves money.

item.title: Hugh Hefner’s youngest son attempts to buy back the Playboy brand
item.description: Cooper Hefner bids $100 million for the company, nearly twice its market cap.

item.title: Americans Cannot Afford Harris’s Home Health Entitlement
item.description: Instead of expanding Medicare’s footprint, we should pursue more-sustainable solutions to address the long-term-care crisis.

item.title: Polymarket tilts toward a Donald Trump victory in the election—but how accurate is it?

item.title: Court decisions in Michigan and North Carolina deny GOP challenges to overseas voters
